citation.article-title: Devosia yakushimensis sp. nov., isolated from root nodules of Pueraria lobata (Willd.) Ohwi
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Devosia yakushimensis sp. nov.
Devosia yakushimensis (ya.ku.shi.men′sis. N.L. fem. adj. yakushimensis pertaining to Yakushima, from where the organism was isolated).
Cells are obligately aerobic, Gram-negative, motile rods of 1.2–2.0 μm long and 0.4–0.6 μm wide that are non-endospore-forming and possess a polar flagellum.
Colonies on TSA are circular with an entire margin (1–2 mm in diameter) and are convex, shiny and beige in colour after 2 days of incubation at 28 °C.
Does not require NaCl for growth, but tolerates up to 2.5 % (w/v) NaCl.
The pH range for growth is narrow at pH 5.5–7.0; good growth occurs at pH 7.0.
The major (85 %) respiratory quinone is ubiquinone 10 (Q10).
Polar lipids consist of phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol.
The predominant fatty acids (>5 %) are 11-methyl C18 : 1ω7c, C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω7c, C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c and C18 : 0.

Positive in tests for the assimilation of d- and l-arabinose, d-ribose, d- and l-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-mannose, l-rhamnose, aesculin, salicin, cellobiose, maltose, d-lactose (bovine origin), d-melibiose, gentiobiose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d- and l-fucose, potassium 5-ketogluconate, d-fructose, l-fucose, myo-inositol, raffinose, d-sorbitol, trehalose and d-gluconic acid.

Produces urease, catalase, oxidase, alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, α- and β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase and α-mannosidase, but not lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase or α-fucosidase.
Weak enzyme activity for esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8) and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase.

Susceptible to amikacin, ampicillin, carbenicillin, cephalotin, chloramphenicol, neomycin, rifampicin, tetracycline and vancomycin, but resistant to ciproflacin, gentamicin, kanamycin, oxacillin and polymyxin B.

The type strain, Yak96BT (=KCTC 22147T=NBRC 103855T=LMG 24299T), was isolated from a root nodule of the kudzu plant [Pueraria lobata (Willd.) Ohwi] thriving on the coast of Yakushima Island, Kagoshima Prefecture, Japan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 65.3 mol%.
